title: Pep Guardiola has 'changed the way we see football,' claims Rio Ferdinand
text:
Pep Guardiola has been hailed as a ‘genius’ (Picture: Getty Images)

Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has ‘changed the way we see football’ according to Rio Ferdinand, who has labelled the Spaniard a ‘genius.’

The former Barcelona and Bayern Munich manager has won two Premier Leagues, an FA Cup and two EFL Cups since arriving in Manchester in 2016.

However, it is not his trophies that Ferdinand is so impressed with, but his innovations in terms of tactics that have been on display since he came to the Premier League.

The former Manchester United defender picked out two tactical tweaks that Guardiola has brought to the UK shores, suggesting that he comes up with new ideas simply out of boredom.

‘He’s got that competitive edge, he’s a genius sitting there,’ Ferdinand told BT Sport. ‘He’s an innovator, he’s changed the way we see football, you talk about goalkeepers coming in and being part of the team, not being detached and just being a goal keeper and being part of the back four. That’s down to him.

Guardiola is very popular with his Manchester City players (Photo by Catherine Ivill/Getty Images)

‘Full-backs playing inside the field now more than ever, it’s crazy some of the stuff he does. Sometimes you think, is it boredom? Was he just bored of winning the way he was before?

Joe Hart, who was ushered out of Manchester City by Guardiola as he looked to use the goalkeeper as part of the defence more, explained how the 48-year-old has wielded such influence at the Premier League champions.

‘He’s demanding, and his demands have to be met, otherwise you’re out,’ Hart told BT Sport. ‘That power isn’t there at a lot of teams, if the manager is not thought of that highly.

‘Other places you’d just wait for the sack, but with him it’s you that’ll go.’
